name: ServiceNow
description: This app integrates with ServiceNow to perform investigative and generic actions

url.description: Device URL including the port, e.g. https://myservicenow.enterprise.com:8080

on_poll_filter.description: Filter to use with On Poll separated by '^' (e.g. description=This is a test^assigned_to=test.name)

client_id.description: Client ID. OAuth will be preferred if provided

client_secret.description: Client Secret. Required with Client ID

first_run_container.description: Max container (For first run of schedule polling)

max_container.description: Max container (For other runs of schedule polling)

severity.description: Severity to apply to Containers and Artifacts ingested via On Poll (Automation user must have System Settings permissions)

actions.description: Run a query on the device to test connection and credentials
Add a work note to a record
actions.verbose: Users can provide a valid ticket number in the 'sys_id' parameter or check the 'is_sys_id' parameter and provide a valid SYS ID in the 'sys_id' parameter. Users can get the SYS ID value for any ticket from the results of the List Tickets action run. For 'work_note' parameter, users can provide new line(\n), single quote(\'), double quote(\") and backspace(\b) as escape sequences.

id.description: SYS ID or ticket number of a record

is_sys_id.description: Whether the value provided in the ID parameter is SYS ID or ticket number

actions.verbose:
Steps for getting the required filter query are as follows: In the ServiceNow instance, navigate to the required table's page. Create the query in the ServiceNow UI. On the top-left corner of the page, right-click on the query string and select the 'Copy query' option to copy the required query string. This query string can be further used or modified as per the user's need to provide in the filter parameter of the action. If the table value is not specified, the action defaults to the incident. If the max_results value is not specified, the action defaults to 100. For specifying and getting the filter to work correctly, below is the criteria for the date-time fields:
  • If the user provides date-time filter based on local timezone as selected on the ServiceNow settings, follow the syntax i.e. sys_created_on>javascript:gs.dateGenerate('YYYY-MM-DD','HH:mm:SS').
  • If the user provides a date-time filter based on GMT/UTC timezone, follow the syntax i.e. sys_created_on>YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS.

filter.description: Filter to use with action separated by '^' (e.g. description=This is a test^assigned_to=john.smith)

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

example_values: Closed before close notes were made mandatory
User can't access email on mail.company.com.
phapp_servicenow_update, Run file reputation actions only

actions.verbose:
Create a new ticket with the given short_description and description (the values provided in the short_description and description action parameters will override the values provided for these keys in the fields action parameter). Additional values can be specified in the fields parameter. By default, the action appends the 'Added by Phantom for container id: ' footnote after the value of description provided either in the description or fields action parameters. If the value for description is not provided in any of the above-mentioned two action parameters, then, the default footnote will be added in the description of the created ticket. Study the results of the get ticket action to get more info about all the properties that can be added. The JSON that is specified in the fields parameter should have the keys and values specified in double-quotes string format, except in the case of boolean values, which should be either True or False (without any single quote) for example: {"short_description": "Zeus, multiple actions need to be taken", "made_sla": False}.

If this action is performed from the playbook the easiest thing to do is create a dictionary (e.g: my_fields_value_dict) and then pass the return value of json.dumps(my_fields_value_dict) as the value of fields. Please see the servicenow_app playbook for an example.

One can specify a table other than the incident to create the ticket in. Do note that the fields for user-generated tables, usually are named with u_ prefix. In such cases, it is better to use the fields parameter to set values.

To set a parent-child relationship between two tickets, specify the parent ticket's ID in a parent_incident field in the fields parameter while creating the child ticket.

ServiceNow restricts the time taken and the file size of attached files, because of which file uploads might fail. These values can be configured by an admin on the ServiceNow device. As of this writing, please go to this link on the ServiceNow Website for more information.

If the table value is not specified, the action defaults to the incident.

ServiceNow does not return an error if an invalid field is updated, or if a valid field is updated in an invalid manner (e.g: updating the caller_id dictionary with your dictionary). For the best results, please check the results of the action in the JSON view to verify the changes.

For short_description action parameter, users can provide new line(\n), tab(\t), single quote(\'), double quote(\"), alarm or beep(\a) and backspace(\b) as escape sequences and for description action parameter, new line(\n, \r), tab(\t), single quote(\'), double quote(\"), alarm or beep(\a) and backspace(\b) can be provided as escape sequences.

vault_id.description: To attach a file to a ticket, the file must first be in the vault. When the Vault ID of a file is provided, it is uploaded and attached to the ticket

example_values: Investigative actions to check for the presence of phapp_servicenow
phapp_servicenow, Multiple action need to be taken

Investigative actions to check for the presence of phapp_servicenow

Added by Splunk for container id: 495
phapp_servicenow, Multiple action need to be taken

actions.verbose: If the table value is not specified, the action defaults to the incident. Users can provide a valid ticket number in the 'id' parameter or check the 'is_sys_id' parameter and provide a valid SYS ID in the 'id' parameter. Users can get the SYS ID value for any ticket from the results of the List Tickets action run.

id.description: SYS ID or ticket number of a record

is_sys_id.description: Whether the value provided in the ID parameter is SYS ID or ticket number

example_values: Closed before close notes were made mandatory
User can't access email on mail.company.com.
phapp_servicenow_update, Run file reputation actions only

actions.verbose:
Update an already existing ticket with the values that are specified in the fields parameter. The user has to know the key names to set in this parameter. Study the results of the get ticket action to get more info about all the properties that can be updated. The JSON that is specified in the 'fields' parameter should have the keys and values specified in double-quotes string format, except in case of boolean values, which should be either 'True' or 'False' (without the single quotes) for example: {"short_description": "Zeus, multiple actions need to be taken", "made_sla": False}

The action first attempts to update the ticket with the values in fields. If this call is successful, it continues to attach the file specified in vault_id. These are two separate calls made to ServiceNow.

ServiceNow restricts the time taken and the file size of attached files, because of which file uploads (of attachments) might fail. These values can be configured by an admin on the ServiceNow device. As of this writing, please go to this link on the ServiceNow Website for more information.

If the table value is not specified, the action defaults to the incident.

ServiceNow does not return an error if an invalid field is updated, or if a valid field is updated in an invalid manner (e.g: updating the caller_id dictionary with your dictionary). For the best results, please check the results of the action in the JSON view to verify the changes. Users can provide a valid ticket number in the 'id' parameter or check the 'is_sys_id' parameter and provide a valid SYS ID in the 'id' parameter. Users can get the SYS ID value for any ticket from the results of the List Tickets action run.

If short_description action parameter is added as key in fields parameter then users can provide new line(\n), tab(\t), single quote(\'), double quote(\"), alarm or beep(\a) and backspace(\b) as escape sequences in the value. Similarly if description action parameter is added as key in fields parameter then, new line(\n, \r), tab(\t), single quote(\'), double quote(\"), alarm or beep(\a) and backspace(\b) can be provided as escape sequences.

vault_id.description: To attach a file to a ticket, the file must first be in the vault. When the vault ID of a file is provided, it is uploaded and attached to the ticket

id.description: SYS ID or ticket number of a record

is_sys_id.description: Whether the value provided in the ID parameter is SYS ID or ticket number

example_values: {"short_description": "phapp_servicenow_update, Run file reputation actions only", "made_sla": false}
Closed before close notes were made mandatory
User can't access email on mail.company.com.
phapp_servicenow_update, Run file reputation actions only

actions.verbose: The System ID for this action can be obtained by the below steps. Navigate to ServiceNow platform and enter sc_item_option_mtom.LIST in the search panel in the left navigation pane. This opens the list of variables in a new tab. Click on the Parent Item and it will open the Requested Item page. Click on the Options menu available in the top-left corner of the page and select the 'Copy sys_id' option to copy the required System ID.

actions.description: Gets object data according to the specified query

query.description: The query to search for e.g. sysparm_query=short_descriptionLIKEaudit

query_table.description: Name of the table to be searched task

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

example_values: Closed before close notes were made mandatory
I can access my folder but can't access my team's folder on our file share
Unable to access team file share

actions.description: Gets user data according to the specified query, username, or system ID

query.description: The query to run. e.g. sysparm_query=user_name=admin

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

actions.verbose: For specifying and getting the On Poll filter (available in config parameters) work correctly for the date-time fields, follow the next steps. If the user provides date-time filter based on local timezone as selected on the ServiceNow settings, follow the syntax i.e. sys_created_on>javascript:gs.dateGenerate('YYYY-MM-DD','HH:MM:SS'). If the user provides a date-time filter based on GMT/UTC timezone, follow the syntax i.e. sys_created_on>YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

container_count.description: Maximum numer of tickets ingest during poll now
